intro: Desmodium vargasianum, commonly known as the velvet bean or hairy cowpea, is a leguminous plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It is characterized by its trifoliate leaves with hairy surfaces and produces small, pea-like flowers that range in color from white to purple. The plant is often found in disturbed soils and is known for its rapid growth and ability to fix atmospheric nitrogen. It is also used as a forage crop and has medicinal properties in some traditional practices. Its seeds are edible and can be processed into a flour-like substance.
